item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For books continue each other, in spite of our habit of judging them separately." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Yet Byron never made tea as you do, who fill the pot so that when you put the lid on the tea spills over. There is a brown pool on the table--it is running among your books and papers. Now you mop it up, clumsily, with your pocket-hankerchief. You then stuff your hankerchief back into your pocket--that is not Byron; that is so essentially you that if I think of you in twenty years' time, when we are both famous, gouty and intolerable, it will be by that scene: and if you are dead, I shall weep." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Mr. McGregor's a nasty piece of work, isn't he? Quite the Darth Vader of children's literature." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Her majesty is one verb short of a sentence." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I suppose he must have taken about a nine or something in hats. Shows what a rotten thing it is to let your brain develop too much." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Warm-hearted! I should think he has to wear asbestos vests!" -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Always learn poems by heart. They have to become the marrow in your bones. Like fluoride in the water, they'll make your soul impervious to the world's soft decay." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Mervyn Peake
item.description: "Lingering is so very lonely when one lingers all alone." -- Mervyn Peake

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Mervyn Peake
item.description: "I am clever enough to know that I am clever." -- Mervyn Peake

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Life stand still here." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Faith-Anne add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I was with book, as a woman is with child." -- C.S. Lewis
